header: ORDER BELOW EXH.1 IN CRIMINAL BAIL APPLICATION No. 50 of 2019 (Dhanashri Vijay Shinde etc.1 Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01­000285­2019

background.text: 1) This the bail application under Sec. 439 of Code of Criminal Procedure is filed by applicants­accused in C.R.No. 22 of 2019 registered with Wai Police Station. 2) Accused were arrested in above mentioned crime on 21.01.2019. The said crime is registered in respect of the offene punishable under Section332, 353, 352, 504, 506 r/w 34 of Indian Penal Code.

under Sec. 439 of Code of Criminal Procedure

arguments.text: Accused are at present in Magisterial Custody. It is stated that, applicants are having house and landed property at the address mentioned, there is no possibility of fleeing, applicants are only earning members of their families, they undertake to abide by the conditions imposed if any.

It is stated that, applicants are having house and landed property at the address mentioned, there is no possibility of fleeing, applicants are only earning members of their families, they undertake to abide by the conditions imposed if any.

arguments.text: 3) The prosecution has filed its say at Exh. 5. It is contended that, A.P.I of Wai police station has no objection to grant bail, hence necessary orders may be passed.

argumentSentences.text: 3) The prosecution has filed its say at Exh. 5.
It is contended that, A.P.I of Wai police station has no objection to grant bail, hence necessary orders may be passed.

arguments.text: 4) Heard learned Advocate for the applicant­accused.

argumentSentences.text: 4) Heard learned Advocate for the applicant­accused.

arguments.text: 5) Considering the nature of offence and no objection of prosecution, accused may be released on bail. Accused are in custody since 21th January, 2019. Considering these facts, applicant­accused may be released on bail. Hence, following order.

argumentSentences.text: 5) Considering the nature of offence and no objection of prosecution, accused may be released on bail.
Accused are in custody since 21th January, 2019.
Considering these facts, applicant­accused may be released on bail.

order.text: O R D E R 1) Criminal Bail Application no. 50 of 2019, is allowed. 2) Applicant­accused Dhanashri Vijay Shinde and Anand Bhimrao Shinde be released on bail on his furnishing P.R.Bond of Rs.15,000/­ (Rs. Fifteen Thousand) with one or two surety / sureties of like amount with following conditions. a) Accused shall not tamper with any evidence. b) Accused shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade him from disclosing such facts to the court or to any Police Officer. c) Accused shall make available themselves and co­operate for interrogation by Police Officer as and when required. d) Any default of above conditions shall render the bail to be cancelled automatically. e) Compliance before lower Court.

footer: (B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date :29th January, 2019. Satara
processedText:
ORDER BELOW EXH.1 IN CRIMINAL BAIL APPLICATION No. 50 of 2019 (Dhanashri Vijay Shinde etc.1 Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01­000285­2019 
---header-ends---
1) This the bail application under Sec. 439 of Code of Criminal Procedure is filed by applicants­accused in C.R.No. 22 of 2019 registered with Wai Police Station. 2) Accused were arrested in above mentioned crime on 21.01.2019. The said crime is registered in respect of the offene punishable under Section332, 353, 352, 504, 506 r/w 34 of Indian Penal Code. 
---background-ends---
Accused are at present in Magisterial Custody. It is stated that, applicants are having house and landed property at the address mentioned, there is no possibility of fleeing, applicants are only earning members of their families, they undertake to abide by the conditions imposed if any.
---argument-ends---
3) The prosecution has filed its say at Exh. 5. It is contended that, A.P.I of Wai police station has no objection to grant bail, hence necessary orders may be passed. 
---argument-ends---
4) Heard learned Advocate for the applicant­accused. 
---argument-ends---
5) Considering the nature of offence and no objection of prosecution, accused may be released on bail. Accused are in custody since 21th January, 2019. Considering these facts, applicant­accused may be released on bail. Hence, following order. 
---argument-ends---
O R D E R 1) Criminal Bail Application no. 50 of 2019, is allowed. 2) Applicant­accused Dhanashri Vijay Shinde and Anand Bhimrao Shinde be released on bail on his furnishing P.R.Bond of Rs.15,000/­ (Rs. Fifteen Thousand) with one or two surety / sureties of like amount with following conditions. a) Accused shall not tamper with any evidence. b) Accused shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade him from disclosing such facts to the court or to any Police Officer. c) Accused shall make available themselves and co­operate for interrogation by Police Officer as and when required. d) Any default of above conditions shall render the bail to be cancelled automatically. e) Compliance before lower Court. 
---order-ends---
(B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date :29th January, 2019. Satara
